Greetings to Eritrean President 
    Pyongyang, May 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on May 22 sent a message of greetings to Eritrean President Issaias Afewerki on the occasion of the 13th independence day of the State of Eritrea.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president and, through him, to the Eritrean government and people, expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger in conformity with the common desire and interests.

Total Abolition of SL Demanded 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- Ro Hoe Chan, secretary general of the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea, addressing a seminar on May 18, demanded the total abolition of the "Security Law," according to the south Korean MBC.
 The charge of failing to report to the police under the Security Law is an anachronistic one going against human rights, he noted, calling on the 17th-term "National Assembly", irrespective of ruling and opposite parties, to abolish the law without any condition.

articles.content:
S. Korean Police Forcibly Walk Away Students 
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police forcibly walked away five students under the Kwangju and South Jolla Provincial Federation of University Student Councils (Namchongryon) on May 18, according to a news report.
 The students held a demo before the May 18 National Cemetery in Mangwoldong, Kwangju, shouting slogans "Inheritance of the spirit of the May resistance", "Repeal the decision on troop dispatch to Iraq at once" and so on., which police said is the reason for their arrest.    
 Angry at this, students under Namchongryon staged a demonstration in denunciation of the police authorities' anti-national action.

DPRK Judoists Prove Successful in Asian Championships
    Pyongyang, May 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK judoists Kim Ryon Mi and Ri Kyong Ok carried away silver medals in the 70kg and 48kg categories and Hong Ok Song, Choe Hyon Ju and An Kum Ae bronze medals in the 63kg, 57kg and 52kg categories at the Asian Judo Championships for 2004 held in Kazakhstan on May 15 and 16.
 The championships drew at least 130 ace judoists from over 20 countries and regions including China, Mongolia and Iran.
